definition: lit. not eating for fear of choking (idiom); fig. to cut off one's nose to spite one's face/to avoid sth essential because of a slight risk
old variant of 因[yin1]
cause/reason/because
to choke (on)/to choke up/to suffocate
to abolish/to abandon/to abrogate/to discard/to depose/to oust/crippled/abandoned/waste
variant of 廢|废[fei4]/disabled
to eat/food/animal feed/eclipse
to feed (a person or animal)

sentences.english: These remarks sound reasonable, yet in fact they are quite illogical.
sentences.chinese: 听起来有理，其实是个因噎废食的逻辑。

sentences.english: People won't stop eating just because of the risk of choking.
But to not practice, to not get an injury would be counterproductive.
sentences.chinese: 但为了躲避伤病而因噎废食的做法只能是适得其反。

sentences.english: Theirworries and considerations are justified, but we should not give up eating for choking.
sentences.chinese: 他们的担心和顾虑是正常的，但是我们不能因噎废食。

sentences.english: However, he said, 'I'm trying to not freak out and just do something.
sentences.chinese: 不过他说，我努力让自己不要因噎废食，而是做点事。

sentences.english: But shall we stop eating for fear of choking?
sentences.chinese: 但我们是否该因噎废食呢？

sentences.english: It sounds reasonable but it is actually a fallacy.
sentences.chinese: 听起来有些理，其实是个因噎废食的逻辑。

sentences.english: Though some deaths happened during the training, we should not give up eating for fear of choking.
sentences.chinese: 尽管训练期间有出现死亡事故，但我们不能因噎废食。

definition: to overcorrect (idiom)/to overcompensate
to deal a single fatal blow/(fig.) to totally repudiate sb because of a minor error
hiding a sickness for fear of treatment (idiom); fig. concealing a fault to avoid criticism/to keep one's shortcomings secret/to refuse to listen to advice
to demand perfection (idiom)
see 拔苗助長|拔苗助长[ba2 miao2 zhu4 zhang3]
to spoil things through excessive enthusiasm (idiom)
man of Qǐ fears the sky falling (idiom); groundless fears
to neglect the root and pursue the tip (idiom)/to neglect fundamentals and concentrate on details
to let sb do whatever they want/to indulge/to give free reins to/to let things slide/to drift aimlessly/laissez-faire
(lit.) to take a part for the whole/to generalize
to act with undue haste (idiom); eager and impatient/overhasty
seeking instant benefit (idiom); shortsighted vision, looking only for fast return
lit. to cut all at one stroke (idiom); to impose uniformity/one solution fits a diversity of problems/one size fits all
lit. to cover one's ears whilst stealing a bell/to deceive oneself/to bury one's head in the sand (idiom)
to cut the feet to fit the shoes (idiom); to force sth to fit (as to a Procrustean bed)/impractical or inelegant solution
blind/blindly/ignorant/lacking understanding
